text: Roger Stuart BerlindMiss Wheeler, Roger Berlind Will Be Wed, NYTimes.com; accessed June 20, 2015. (June 27, 1930December 18, 2020) was an American theatre producer and businessman. Berlind was born in New York City. He worked for Lehman Brothers. Berlind won fifteen Tony Awards for many of his stage productions. He produced Amadeus, The Book of Mormon and Guys and Dolls. Berlind died in New York City on December 18, 2020 of cardiopulmonary arrest at the age of 90.Roger Berlind, 90, Dies; Broadway Impresario Who Amassed 25 Tonys ==References== Category:1930 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from cardiopulmonary arrest Category:Theatre producers Category:Businesspeople from New York City Category:Tony Award winners
